node.title: Candle factory "looks as if a bomb has dropped on it," mayor says
node.description: "We hope there are still rescues to be made," Kathy Stewart O'Nan said. "We fear that it is now just recovery."
node.content: ["The mayor of Mayfield, Kentucky, said a candle factory in her city where dozens of people were trapped amid severe weather \"looks as if a bomb has dropped on it.\" ", "\"We hope there are still rescues to be made,\" Kathy Stewart O'Nan told CBS News' Lana Zak on Saturday. \"We fear that it is now just recovery.\" ", "There were 110 workers in the factory \u2014 Mayfield Consumer Products \u2014 when a tornado hit the area as part of a wider storm system that lashed the central U.S. overnight. O'Nan said the building has \"completely collapsed,\" and officials said about 40 people have been rescued.", "Pictures showed the factory in shreds and response workers digging through heaps of rubble.\u00a0 \u00a0", "O'Nan said the factory had been very busy because of the holiday season.", "\"We are very proud of this candle factory because it was begun by a local family, and it has just grown to a very large part of our community,\" she said. \u00a0", "The governor said earlier that at least 70 people are dead in the state. Tennessee and Illinois have also reported several storm-related fatalities.\u00a0", "Tori B. Powell is a breaking news reporter at CBS News. Reach her at tori.powell@viacomcbs.com"]
